page.title: 01PRESTON ( SOUTH )
page.content: This block is suitably,if unevenly, divided into{three}parts:by the River Ribble looping E to W,and containing the town-centre areas of{Frenchwood (and its School),Avenham and Broad- gate,at the upper part of the block; then,by the London-to- Glasgow main railway line, which splits the block into SW'ly and SE'ly suburban areas. To the SW lies{Penwortham,}with King- sfold School. Here, housing has been added to by the Central Lancs.Devel't Corporation.A newly completed Western Primary road services the recent urban growth to the S and W of Preston. To the SE lies{Walton-le-Dale}(with St.Leonard's School) and Bamber Bridge with Lostock Hall along our S'ly line These areas also have had C.L.D.C.dev_ elopments, mainly in housing and road- building,altering their earlier almost semi-rural and independent character.
